item.latestTitle: A bill to amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to provide that military technicians (dual status) shall be included in military personnel accounts for purposes of any order issued under that Act.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Budget.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.title: To amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to provide that military technicians (dual status) shall be included in military personnel accounts for purposes of any order issued under that Act.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Budget.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Mr. PALAZZO:H.R. 1014.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 section 8 of the Constitution which givesCongress the power, To raise and support Armies, To provideand maintain a Navy, To make Rules for the Government andRegulation of the land and naval forces. To provide fororganizing, arming, and disciplining, the Militia, and forgoverning such part of them as may be employed in the Serviceof the United States.[Page H1321]

item.title: To amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to provide that military technicians (dual status) shall be included in military personnel accounts for purposes of any order issued under that Act.

To amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to provide that military technicians (dual status) shall be included in military personnel accounts for purposes of any order issued under that Act.

item.text: Amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act) to include military technicians (dual status) in military personnel accounts for purposes of any sequestration order issued by the President after January 1, 2013.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Budget.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
